On 5/25/05, Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:
> Also some peo=
ple on this group have been through looking for a program
> before.  It's t=
ough in North America since hardly anywhere has any
> TWEANN or AE research=
 going on.  There are a ton of programs ranked
> highly in AI, but for some=
 reason they aren't doing the stuff we're
> interested in.  

Yep...as Ken =
mentioned in a previous mail, I was recently accepted to
the Cognitive Scie=
nce PhD program at the University of Louisiana at
Lafayette:

http://ics.lo=
uisiana.edu/

I looked around a lot of other programs, but focused on UL fo=
r several reasons:

a) They have a PhD program in Cognitive Science that do=
es not require
a Masters as a prerequisite.  Most places I looked at also r=
equired
that your PhD be in an established field (such as Computer Science)=
,
with only an emphasis on Cognitive Science.

b) They have an "Artificial =
Neural Networks Analysis Project
Laboratory".  I don't know the details, bu=
t it was encouraging that
they're working with artificial neural networks.
=

c) The director of the program was friendly and receptive in
communication=
s.  It's a smaller school and a relatively small program,
so I felt I would=
 probably have more freedom to pursue what I was
interested in.  I'll let y=
ou know if that's the case. :)

Derek
